poem:
Title: In an Age of Digital Resolve

On Welsh streets, a scourge, 
Hate's graffiti- stark in view.
An app emerges, a cygnet born from Swansea,
Ready to swallow such vile hues. 

StreetSnap, the remedy, a digital broom,
Clearing the litter of intolerance, to bloom.
Reflecting not the world as it is,
But as it should be - bias in ruin.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Welsh StreetSnap app targets racist and homophobic graffiti A groundbreaking scheme designed to help clear streets of hate graffiti and pinpoint flare-ups of racism and homophobia is being pioneered in Wales. At the centre of the project is an app called StreetSnap, developed by Swansea University, that will be formally launched in January in Bridgend county borough and is being looked at by local authorities across the UK including a central London council. The app". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
